intro: Xysmalobium reflectens, commonly known as the silverleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which reflects light and helps reduce water loss in arid environments. Xysmalobium reflectens thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
